member.name: M:Emc.InputAccel.UimScript.IUimDataContext.UnmarkFieldForValidationRule(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Unmarks a dependent field so that the rule validation error is not shown for the unmarked field.

remarks.para: The specified field is only unmarked for the specified validation rule, not for other rules that depend on the field. A dependent field may be unmarked but cannot be marked again.

This method should be called during the DocumentLoad event to prevent the field from being marked with rule the validation error. Unmarking a dependent field after the validation rule has run will not clear any existing validation error. In this case, you must execute the rule again or explicitly clear the error.
If the rule does not contain as a dependent field, the method does nothing and no error is returned.
This method is not supported in the .NET Code module.

member.param: The case-insensitive rule name.
The case-insensitive field name.

member.name: M:Emc.InputAccel.UimScript.IUimDataContext.ApproximateMatch(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns a value that indicates the similarity of two strings.

remarks.para: The returned value is in the range of 0 - 100 where 0 indicates no similarity at all and 100 indicates a perfect match.

The match is determined by the length of the longest string minus the minimum number character replacements needed to get a complete match. Each insertion, deletion, or update decreases one from the cost. The returned value is ((maxlen - replaceCharCount) * 100) / maxlen.

Because this operation is very computationally intensive, to limit the computing time, only first 80 characters are used for detecting minimum number of corrections needed. After 80 characters, a simple positional compare is used. As a result, for strings longer than 80 characters, the return value may not represent minimum changes needed but approximately identifies the amount of change needed.

member.param: First string
Second string
If true, compare case sensitive
member.returns: Approximate match as a value between 0 - 100

member.summary: Gets the text value for the field.
member.remarks: The field text does not necessarily match the field value. If this is a numeric or date/time field and OCR extracts or the user enters a value that cannot be parsed according to the data type, such as entering "ABC" for a numeric field, the text is that from OCR or the user but the underlying value is the default for the field type.

member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this field is an array field.

member.name: P:Emc.InputAccel.UimScript.IUimFieldDataContext.ArrayIndex
member.summary: Gets the zero-based index of this field in its array or 0 if this is not an array field.

member.name: P:Emc.InputAccel.UimScript.IUimFieldDataContext.Value
member.summary: Gets the data value for the field.
member.remarks: This will be the type specific default value if the text could not be parsed according to the field format specification. The value may also be invalid if the field has a validation error.

member.name: P:Emc.InputAccel.UimScript.IUimFieldDataContext.ValueAsDouble
member.summary: Gets the data value as a double.
member.remarks: If the value cannot be converted an exception is thrown. Booleans are converted to 0 if false and 1 if true. DateTimes are converted to the number of days since midnight, 30 December 1899.

member.name: P:Emc.InputAccel.UimScript.IUimFieldDataContext.ValueAsInt
member.summary: Gets the data value as a 32-bit integer (Int32).
member.remarks: If the value cannot be converted an exception is thrown. Booleans are converted to 0 if false and 1 if true. Doubles and decimals are rounded down.

member.name: P:Emc.InputAccel.UimScript.IUimFieldDataContext.ValueAsDecimal
member.summary: Gets the data value as a decimal.
member.remarks: If the value cannot be converted an exception is thrown. Booleans are converted to 0 if false and 1 if true.

member.name: P:Emc.InputAccel.UimScript.IUimFieldDataContext.ValueAsString
member.summary: Gets the data value as a string.
member.remarks: If the value cannot be converted an exception is thrown. Booleans are converted to "false" or "true".

member.name: P:Emc.InputAccel.UimScript.IUimFieldDataContext.ValueAsBoolean
member.summary: Gets the data value as a boolean.
member.remarks: If the value cannot be converted an exception is thrown. Values that can be converted are 0, 1, or "true" or "false", both case-insensitive.

member.name: P:Emc.InputAccel.UimScript.IUimFieldDataContext.ValueAsDate
member.summary: Gets the data value as a DateTime.
member.remarks: If the value cannot be converted an exception is thrown. Only dates and times in string format can be converted.

member.name: M:Emc.InputAccel.UimScript.IUimFieldDataContext.SetValue(System.Object)
member.summary: Sets the data value, updating the text shown in UI.

remarks.para: When the field value is set, the new value is formatted and displayed in the UI. When the method is called during Identification, Extraction, and Completion, the validation rules for the field are also reevaluated. Formatting and rule evaluation are both true whether or not the new value is different than the current value.
If has a different data type than the field, the value is converted to the field's data type. If the conversion fails, the field value and text are both set to the default for the field's data type.

This method is the same as calling
with the low-confidence character handling set to .

member.param: The new field value.

member.name: M:Emc.InputAccel.UimScript.IUimFieldDataContext.SetValue(System.Object,Emc.InputAccel.UimScript.LowConfidenceCharacters)
member.summary: Sets the data value, updating the UI text and the list of characters to repair.

remarks.para: The is only applied if the field value was originally extracted from an image.

When the field value is set, the new value is formatted and displayed in the UI. When the method is called during Identification, Extraction, and Completion, the validation rules for the field are also reevaluated. Formatting and rule evaluation are both true whether or not the new value is different than the current value.
If has a different data type than the field, the value is converted to the field's data type. If the conversion fails, the field value and text are both set to the default for the field's data type.

member.param: The new field value.
The way that question mark ("?") characters are handled in the new value. This parameter has only effect when the is true.

member.name: M:Emc.InputAccel.UimScript.IUimFieldDataContext.SetValidationError(System.Exception)
member.summary: Marks or clears the validation error.

remarks.para: Fields with field errors or validation rule failures are marked with validation errors by the system; these errors are cleared once the field value is correct and the rules do not fail. This method provides a mechanism for manually marking or clearing errors outside of the automated mechanism.
If the field has an error and is not null, the new exception replaces the existing error.
When possible, manually setting and clearing validation errors should be avoided. Instead, allow the module to manage error states using field properties and validation rules.

member.param: A non-null exception to mark the field in error or null to clear existing field and validation-rule errors.

member.name: M:Emc.InputAccel.UimScript.IUimFieldDataContext.FormatValue(System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Formats a value using the specified locale and configured field syntax.

remarks.para: This method provides a way for a script to access the formatting capabilities of a field format without any explicit knowledge of the field settings.

If has a different data type than the field, the value is converted to the field's data type. If the conversion fails, the returned text is the default value for the field's data type as a formatted string.

example.para: If the field is a number field that is configured to use 2 decimal places and the value is the number 42, the value returned by this method is "42.00".

member.param: The value to format.
The locale name such as "en-US" to use for formatting the object or null to use the current document locale. Supported locales are those supported by the .NET framework.
member.returns: The formatted text.

member.name: M:Emc.InputAccel.UimScript.IUimFieldDataContext.Parse(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Parses a string into an object using the specified locale and configured field syntax.

remarks.para: This method provides a way for a script to access the parsing capabilities of a field format without any explicit knowledge of the field settings.
If parsing fails, an exception is thrown.

example.para: If the field is a number field and the string is "42.20", the value returned by this method is the number 42.2.

member.param: The text to parse.
The locale name such as "en-US" to use for parsing the text or null to use the current document locale. Supported locales are those supported by the .NET framework.
member.returns: The value of the parsed text as an object of the same data type as the field on which this method is called.

member.name: M:Emc.InputAccel.UimScript.IUimFieldDataContext.MarkValueChanged
member.summary: Causes the value to be considered "updated," reevaluating the related validation rules.

remarks.para: This method does not change either the field value or text.

member.name: M:Emc.InputAccel.UimScript.IUimFieldDataContext.HasUnflaggedError(System.String)
member.summary: Determines whether this field has an error that is not suppressed by the specified flag on either the field or a related dependent field.

remarks.para: The method returns true if all of the following are true:

item.description: The field has an error.
The field does not contain the specified flag.
If the error is a validation rule error, no other field for the same error contains the specified flag.

remarks.para: When an operator in Identification or Completion applies a flag to a field that has a validation rule error, the error is suppressed in the UI for both that field containing the flag and all other dependent fields with the same error. In cases where a flag is used to indicate that the error is allowed, the script must determine which errors are allowed and which are not. A script can use this method to determine whether the error on a field has been suppressed by the operator using a specific flag.

member.param: The value of the flag to test.
member.returns: True if the field has an error that is not suppressed by the specified flag.

member.name: M:Emc.InputAccel.UimScript.IUimScriptFilterContext.CreateAndApplyAnnotation(System.Windows.Rect,System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Double,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new annotation and applies it to the image after the script completes.

remarks.para: The foreground and background colors must be formatted as 4 bytes of ARGB with Alpha as the most significant byte and Blue as the least significant byte.
The font used for text annotations is not configurable.

Annotations created with this method are applied to the image in the order they were created. If annotations in the profile are also applied by calling , those annotations are applied before any custom annotations.

member.param: Rectangle in pixels where the annotation is applied.
The type of the annotation. The value must be one of: "Redaction", "Text", "Highlight", or "Comment". Other types are not supported.
The color used for border and text. Refer to Remarks for details on the format.
The color used for the background, redactions, and highlights. Refer to Remarks for details on the format.
The opacity of the annotation. The valid range is 0.0-1.0 where 0.0 is transparent and 1.0 is opaque.
The text shown for text annotations and included as a comment for all other annotation types. The text can use placeholders to substitute variables from batch node values.

member.name: T:Emc.InputAccel.UimScript.UimLccScript
member.summary: Class UimLccScript is the base class for all UIM scripting modules used to access LCC batch. A LCC scripting module is run when a noop step is configured for scripting. The scripting class must extend this class and have a class name based on the process flow name as "Custom.LccUimScript.Script[process flow name with spaces replaced by underscore]". For every step that is configured for scripting, a method with the following signature is invoked. Execute[step name, with spaces replaced by underscore](ILccBatch batch, string customString, int customInt); Step name is case sensitive.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of this class.

member.summary: Called when the script instance is discarded.

member.name: M:Emc.InputAccel.UimScript.UimScriptBatchCreate.CanStartCycle(Emc.InputAccel.UimScript.IUimScriptBatchCreateServiceContext)
member.summary: Fired when the module needs to test whether to begin a polling cycle.
member.param: An object that contains information about the running module.
member.returns: true if a cycle can start, false otherwise

remarks.para: This event is only fired when the profile has no polling expression. Otherwise the expression is used to control polling cycle timing.

The event enables a script to apply more complex logic than just time of day to control polling cycles. As the event will be fired frequently while waiting for a cycle to begin, it should return quickly.

member.name: M:Emc.InputAccel.UimScript.UimScriptBatchCreate.ProcessList(Emc.InputAccel.UimScript.IUimScriptBatchCreateListContext,System.Collections.Generic.IList{Emc.InputAccel.UimScript.IImportNodeItem})
member.summary: Fired when a set of items is about to be assembled into a batch.
member.param: An object that contains information about the running module and is used to control the content and structure fof the batch.
The raw list of items for the batch. The list contains the original node breaks that define the tree structure.

remarks.para: This event is fired after the module scans a directory and prepares a list of items. The module orders the files according to the profile configuration and inserts breaks to identify:

item.para: Which items are to be removed from the batch
Which items are to be deferred to another batch
Where tree node breaks are found

remarks.para: It also initializes the list ID, batch name, and batch priority.

The script uses this event to change the structure and data of the batch. After the method returns, it will be called again as long as items remain to be processed. Each call will result in the module creating one batch. The module does not watch for new items until all items have been processed by either adding them to a batch or by setting their status to to permanently skip them.
For more details on manipulating the list of items, see the topic Defining the Batch Structure in the Scripting Guide.

If the node has been repositioned within the same parent, and are the same. The method is only called for nodes that are explicitly moved; it is not executed for other affected nodes. When a node is split, the new node is first created for which NodeAdded is called. The new node immediately follows the node which was split in the task tree. Each affected child node is then moved to its new parent with

If the node is deleted from any position other than the last within its parent,
is not called for other nodes whose positions have been affected (those moved up in the node list).

When two nodes are merged, each affected child node of the second node is moved to its new parent with a

member.name: M:Emc.InputAccel.UimScript.UimScriptMainCore.DocumentTypeChanged(Emc.InputAccel.UimScript.IUimDataContext,Emc.InputAccel.UimScript.IUimDataContext)
member.summary: Called when the user changes the type of a document.

remarks.para: New scripts should not use this method as it is global to the entire system. Instead, override which enables per-task logic. However, the method in this class will be called if the per-task method is not overriden.

The user can use this method to initialize values in the new document including copying data from the old document. The old document is discarded after the type change is complete, so any modification to its values will be lost.

member.param: The old document before the type was changed.
The new, empty document with the changed type.

member.name: M:Emc.InputAccel.UimScript.UimScriptMainCore.BeforeDocumentExtracted(System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.Object})
member.summary: Called before data is extracted from a document.

remarks.para: This event is fired once for each document before Extraction processes any of the pages in that document. A script author can use it to initialize state used during the extraction process, such as scripts executed as part of the freeform rules.

The dictionary is populated with document-level IA values that are defined on the Extraction step. For each IA value with the naming pattern "PreUimData_<ValueName>", contains an entry called "<ValueName>". For example, if the Extraction step contains the dynamic value "PreUimData_First" with a value of "test" and "PreUimData_Second" with a value of 4, then will contain two entries: "First" = "test" and "Second" = 4.
As the dictionary is discarded after the event has completed, any modification to its contents will be lost.

member.param: Dictionary of document level IA values.

member.name: M:Emc.InputAccel.UimScript.UimScriptMainCore.ModuleBatchListView(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.List{Emc.InputAccel.CaptureClient.ITableRow},System.String,System.String[])

remarks.para: Although supports lookups by both column index and name, this method should only use column indexes as the names are localized. The returned columns for each batch are:

item.description: Name
ID
Task count
Create date and time
Priority
Description

remarks.para: The contents of each row must be treated as read-only and must not be changed.

member.param: The ID of the currently executing module such as "CPDSKTOP" for Completion or "CPIDENTF" for Identification.
The table of batches, one per row.
The domain and user name used to login to the Captiva Capture server or "*" for the system user as returned by
The current departments for the module.

member.name: M:Emc.InputAccel.UimScript.UimScriptTask.TaskLoad(Emc.InputAccel.UimScript.IUimNodeData)
member.summary: Fired after the task and all of its nodes have loaded.
member.param: The root node for the task.

remarks.para: For Identification and Completion, the order of execution is: DocumentLoad for all documents, TaskLoad for the task, and then FormLoad for the indexing form if appropriate. This ensures that the documents are all loaded before the this event handler works with them.
Scripts can use this event for auditing or other once-per-task setup.

member.name: M:Emc.InputAccel.UimScript.UimScriptTask.BeforeTaskFinish(Emc.InputAccel.UimScript.IUimNodeData,Emc.InputAccel.UimScript.CloseReasonCode)
member.summary: Fired after the user requests to finish the task or after the task completes if auto-advance is enabled but before the task finishes.

remarks.para: The script is responsible for showing a message to the user to indicate why the task will not finish.
This can be used in Identification to:

item.description: Verify that the templates in each document are valid.
Verify that the templates in each document are in the correct order.
Verify that the documents in each folder are valid.
Verify that the documents in each folder are in the correct order.

remarks.para: This can be used in Extraction or Completion to:

item.description: Verify that the data in each document is valid.

remarks.para: If any document in the task has an error and has set to true, then this event does not fire as the task has cannot be finished yet.
If this event returns , documents will be unloaded with no other events. Scripts can use this event for auditing or other once-per-task teardown.

member.param: The root node for the task.
The reason the task is finishing.
member.returns: A value indicating whether the module should complete the task. The value is ignored and the module task is saved but not finished if the task is finished because an idle session timeout limit has been reached.

member.name: M:Emc.InputAccel.UimScript.UimScriptTask.FlagsChanged(Emc.InputAccel.UimScript.IUimDataContext,Emc.InputAccel.UimScript.IUimDataContext,Emc.InputAccel.UimScript.IUimPageContext,Emc.InputAccel.UimScript.IUimFieldDataContext)
member.summary: Fired when flags are added or removed.

remarks.para: This event is only fired when flags are changed by an operator. Settings flags by modifying IA values before the task loads or in a script will not cause this event to be fired.

If a document-type script needs to be run in response to flags changed event, the script can be accessed throught the
property.

member.param: The document in which flags were changed. This is never null, even if document flags were not changed.
The pre-index data of the page in which flags changed; null if pages flags were not changed. This parameter is only used by the Identification module.
The page which has flags changed; null if page flags were not changed.
The field which has flags changed; null if field flags were not changed. This parameter is only used by the Completion module.

member.name: M:Emc.InputAccel.UimScript.UimScriptTask.PageIdentified(Emc.InputAccel.UimScript.IUimNodeData,Emc.InputAccel.UimScript.IRecognitionProject,Emc.InputAccel.UimScript.IUimTemplate[])
member.summary: Fired after a page template has changed.

remarks.para: Scripts can use this event to assign templates to pages based on the current page.

Each entry in the pageTemplates array contains null if the page has not been classified or the template for the page if the page was classified. To assign a template to a page, retrieve the template from the project and set its value in the pageTemplates array. Page templates can be reused as many times as needed for this. To remove the template for a page, such as when the page is known to be misclassified, set its value in the array to null.

member.param: The page which had its template changed.
The recognition project that can be used to get templates for assignment to other pages.
The array of templates for all pages in the document containing the changed page.

member.name: M:Emc.InputAccel.UimScript.UimScriptTask.DocumentIdentified(Emc.InputAccel.UimScript.IUimNodeData,System.String,Emc.InputAccel.UimScript.IRecognitionProject,Emc.InputAccel.UimScript.IUimTemplate[])
member.summary: Fired after a document type has changed in Identification when the step is configured to auto-assign templates.

remarks.para: Scripts can use this event to assign templates to pages based on the document type.

The previous classification of pages in this document can be read by calling
on the document.

To assign a template to a page, retrieve the template from the project and set its value in the documentPages array. Page templates can be reused as many times as needed for this. To remove the template for a page, such as when the page is known to be misclassified, set its value in the array to null. All template changes are applied after the event exits.

member.param: The document which had been identified.
The template code used if the document was identified by setting a template code, null if the if the document was identified by setting a document type.
The recognition project that can be used to get templates for assignment to pages.
The array of templates for all pages in the document. The input value is the list automatically proposed by the module. See the remarks for details on how to use this array to assign templates.

member.name: M:Emc.InputAccel.UimScript.UimScriptTask.BeforeShowTemplates(Emc.InputAccel.UimScript.IUimNodeData,System.Collections.Generic.IList{Emc.InputAccel.UimScript.IUimTemplate})
member.summary: Fired before the list of templates is shown to the operator in Identification.

remarks.para: Scripts can use this event to reorder or filter the list of templates that are shown to the operator for the next page.

When the step is configured to use template code-oriented keying, only the template codes from the nextPageTemplates list are shown to the operator. Each template code is shown only once, independent of how many times that code appears in the template list, and the template codes are displayed in the order that each is first found in the list.

member.param: The page that will be classified using the list of templates passed to this event.
The list of templates that will be shown for the next page.
